p:
Typhoons mostly occur in southeast China and are much less researched on than floods, likely because of the relatively less significant human and economic loss. Research findings on typhoons are similar to those for floods, with association with infectious diarrhea found,
199
,
200
,
201 except for one study in Guangdong,
202 and with PTSD.
203
,
204 A study in Guangzhou found that typhoon could increase the all-cause mortality, particularly among female, very young and old population.
205 Other health outcomes examined include injuries
206 and related risk factors,
207 emergency room visits as proxy.
208
